Package space.sunqian.fs.base.string

Class StringKit

java.lang.Object
space.sunqian.fs.base.string.StringKit
public class StringKit extends Object
Utilities kit for string related.

    • uncapitalize

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull String uncapitalize(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence str)
      Uncapitalizes the given string. Specifically, if the given string's length >= 2 and its chars are all upper case, the original string is also returned.
      Parameters:
      str - the given string
      Returns:
      the uncapitalized string

    • indexOf

      public static int indexOf(CharSequence str, char c)
      Returns the first index of the specified char in the specified string. The returned value is the smallest value k such that: 
      
 (str.charAt(k) == ch) && (k >= 0)
      If no such k is found, returns -1.
      Parameters:
      str - the specified string
      c - the specified char
      Returns:
      the first index of the specified char in the specified string, or -1 if not found

    • indexOf

      public static int indexOf(CharSequence str, char c, int index)
      Returns the first index of the specified char in the specified string, starting at the specified index. The returned value is the smallest value k such that: 
      
 (str.charAt(k) == ch) && (k >= index)
      If no such k is found, returns -1.

      There is no restriction on the index. If it is negative, it has the same effect as if it were 0; if it is greater than str.length(), it has the same effect as if it were str.length() (-1 is returned).

      Parameters:
      str - the specified string
      c - the specified char
      index - the specified index
      Returns:
      the first index of the specified char in the specified string, starting at the specified index, or -1 if not found

    • lastIndexOf

      public static int lastIndexOf(CharSequence str, char c)
      Returns the last index of the specified char in the specified string, searching backward. The returned value is the largest value k such that: 
      
 (str.charAt(k) == ch) && (k <= str.length() - 1)
      If no such k is found, returns -1.
      Parameters:
      str - the specified string
      c - the specified char
      Returns:
      the last index of the specified char in the specified string, searching backward, or -1 if not found

    • lastIndexOf

      public static int lastIndexOf(CharSequence str, char c, int index)
      Returns the last index of the specified char in the specified string, searching backward starting at the specified index. The returned value is the largest value k such that: 
      
 (str.charAt(k) == ch) && (k <= index)
      If no such k is found, returns -1.

      There is no restriction on the index. If it is negative, it has the same effect as if it were -1 (-1 is returned); if it is greater than or equal to str.length(), it has the same effect as if it were str.length() - 1.

      Parameters:
      str - the specified string
      c - the specified char
      index - the specified index
      Returns:
      the last index of the specified char in the specified string, searching backward starting at the specified index, or -1 if not found

    • indexOf

      public static int indexOf(CharSequence str, CharSequence sub)
      Returns the first index of the specified substring in the specified string. The returned value is the smallest value k for which: 
      
 (k >= 0) && str.startsWith(sub, k)
      If no such k is found, returns -1.

      The behavior of this method is the same as String.indexOf(String).

      Parameters:
      str - the specified string
      sub - the specified substring
      Returns:
      the first index of the specified substring in the specified string, or -1 if not found

    • indexOf

      public static int indexOf(CharSequence str, CharSequence sub, int index)
      Returns the first index of the specified substring in the specified string, starting at the specified index. The returned value is the smallest value k for which: 
      
 (k >= index) && str.startsWith(sub, k)
      If no such k is found, returns -1.

      The behavior of this method is the same as String.indexOf(String, int).

      Parameters:
      str - the specified string
      sub - the specified substring
      index - the specified index
      Returns:
      the first index of the specified substring in the specified string, starting at the specified index, or -1 if not found

    • lastIndexOf

      public static int lastIndexOf(CharSequence str, CharSequence sub)
      Returns the last index of the specified substring in the specified string, searching backward. The returned value is the smallest value k for which: 
      
 (k <= str.length() - 1) && str.startsWith(sub, k)
      If no such k is found, returns -1.

      The behavior of this method is the same as String.lastIndexOf(String).

      Parameters:
      str - the specified string
      sub - the specified substring
      Returns:
      the last index of the specified substring in the specified string, searching backward, or -1 if not found

    • lastIndexOf

      public static int lastIndexOf(CharSequence str, CharSequence sub, int index)
      Returns the last index of the specified substring in the specified string, searching backward starting at the specified index. The returned value is the largest value k for which: 
      
 (k <= index) && str.startsWith(sub, k)
      If no such k is found, returns -1.

      The behavior of this method is the same as String.lastIndexOf(String, int).

      Parameters:
      str - the specified string
      sub - the specified substring
      index - the specified index
      Returns:
      the last index of the specified substring in the specified string, searching backward starting at the specified index, or -1 if not found

    • startsWith

      public static boolean startsWith(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence str, @Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence sub)
      Returns whether the specified string is starts with the specified substring.

      The behavior of this method is the same as String.startsWith(String).

      Parameters:
      str - the specified string
      sub - the specified substring
      Returns:
      whether the specified string is starts with the specified substring

    • startsWith

      public static boolean startsWith(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence str, @Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence sub, int index)
      Returns whether the specified string is starts with the specified substring, the comparing starting at the specified index.

      The behavior of this method is the same as String.startsWith(String, int).

      Parameters:
      str - the specified string
      sub - the specified substring
      index - the specified index
      Returns:
      whether the specified string is starts with the specified substring

    • endsWith

      public static boolean endsWith(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence str, @Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence sub)
      Returns whether the specified string is ends with the specified substring.

      The behavior of this method is the same as String.endsWith(String).

      Parameters:
      str - the specified string
      sub - the specified substring
      Returns:
      whether the specified string is ends with the specified substring

    • toString

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull String toString(@Nullable @Nullable Object obj)
      Returns the toString of the given object. If the given object is array, uses Arrays.toString or Arrays.deepToString(Object[]) if necessary.

      This method is equivalent to (toStringWith(Object, boolean, boolean)): toStringWith(obj, true, true).

      Parameters:
      obj - the given object
      Returns:
      the toString of the given object

    • toStringAll

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull String toStringAll(@Nullable @Nullable Object @Nonnull ... objs)
      Returns the toString of the given objects via Arrays.deepToString(Object[]).
      Parameters:
      objs - the given objects
      Returns:
      the toString of the given objects via Arrays.deepToString(Object[])

    • toStringWith

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull String toStringWith(@Nullable @Nullable Object obj, boolean arrayToString, boolean deep)
      Returns the toString of the given object. This method follows the following logic:
      • If the given object is not an array, returns Objects.toString(Object).
      • If the arrayToString is true:
        • If the deep is true, uses Arrays.deepToString(Object[]) for them. Otherwise, uses Arrays.toString.
      • Returns Objects.toString(Object) otherwise.
      Parameters:
      obj - the given object
      arrayToString - the arrayToString option
      deep - the deep option
      Returns:
      the toString of the given object

    • charEquals

      public static boolean charEquals(CharSequence cs1, CharSequence cs2)
      Compares the given two CharSequence instances, returns true if they have same length and two chars at the same index in two sequences are equal, otherwise false.
      Parameters:
      cs1 - the first CharSequence to compare
      cs2 - the second CharSequence to compare
      Returns:
      true if they have same length and two chars at the same index in two sequences are equal, otherwise false

    • charsCopy

      public static void charsCopy(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence str, int start, int end, char @Nonnull [] dst, int off) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Copies chars from the given string into the specified destination char array. The chars copied starting at the specified start index inclusive, and ending at the specified end index exclusive. The destination array receives starting at the specified offset.

      The behavior of this method is the same as String.getChars(int, int, char[], int).

      Parameters:
      str - the given string of which chars will be copied
      start - the specified start index, inclusive
      end - the specified end index, exclusive
      dst - the specified destination char array
      off - the specified offset
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if there exists an arguments is out of bounds

    • charsCopy

      public static void charsCopy(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence src, int srcOff, char @Nonnull [] dst, int dstOff, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Copies the specified length of chars from the given source, starting at the specified source offset, to the given destination array, starting at the specified destination offset.

      The behavior of this method is the same as System.arraycopy(Object, int, Object, int, int).

      Parameters:
      src - the given source
      srcOff - the specified source offset
      dst - the given destination array
      dstOff - the specified destination offset
      len - the specified copy length
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if there exists an arguments is out of bounds
